item.title: TESS Community Science Center team at AAS 230
item.description: The 230th American Astronomical Society is just around the corner. Team members from TESS's Community Science Center will be there to represent the mission. Come find us at at our booth where we will be joined by NExScI, Kepler/K2 and the Exoplanet Program Office. We will be available to …
item.dc:creator: Tom Barclay

item.title: Volunteer to review proposals
item.description: The TESS Community Science Center is responsible for organizing the review of proposals submitted to the TESS Guest Investigator program. Our first cycle deadline is anticipated to be in early approximately October, with the in-person peer review likely taking place in early December. We are currently looking for volunteers with …
item.dc:creator: Tom Barclay

item.title: Tell us about the software tool and data products you would like
item.description: The TESS Community Science Cneter at NASA Goddard are currently collecting input from the scientific community on what you would like to see developed. We have some plans but we are seeking more input. What do you need to achieve your science goals? Get in touch at tessgi@bigbang.gsfc …
item.dc:creator: Tom Barclay

item.title: Space hardware development and going well
item.description:
The TESS hardware development is progressing well. All four camera are currently being tested and performing excellently.

TESS is a NASA Explorer class mission.
item.dc:creator: Tom Barclay

item.title: Development of new TESS website
item.description: The Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite are transitioning to a news website. This is that website. Lots more content coming soon.
item.dc:creator: Tom Barclay
